levels.levelInfo:
Below there are two Arrays, an Array stores a set of data, in this case a set of numbers.

The Input block will remove the first value in the Array and store it in a Variable for later use.

A Variable is used to store a value, in this case a number. (An Array is a special type of Variable)

The output block will take the value currently stored and add it to your final output Array

Try using a combination of these blocks and then click 'Run Function' to try and solve this problem!

In the last level you used the blocks to create a Function!

A Function is a set of instructions used to perform a task.

The Input and Output blocks can be used multiple times, try it now to solve the problem!

An If block is used to check whether something is true or false.

Here you will select a number between 1-9 to compare to the stored value. Blocks placed after opening an If block will be nested inside of the If block.

If the number is the same as the stored value, the If block will return true and the blocks nested inside of the If block will run.

If the number is not the same as the stored value, the If block will return true and the blocks nested inside of the If block will not run.

You can close an If block by clicking the 'Close Current If/Loop' button that will appear once opened!

A loop block can be used to run a set of instructions multiple times without writing/placing each instruction more than once!

Here you will select a number betwen 1-9 to choose how many times the loop will run

Blocks placed after opening a Loop block will be nested inside of the Loop block. These blocks will run as many times as specified in the loop!

You can close an If block by clicking the 'Close Current If/Loop' button that will appear once opened!

Level Hint: You do not have to empty an array to complete a level!
Use your new understanding of If blocks and Loop blocks to create a function to solve this problem!
